Chapter 6 Mapping in R 6.1 Basics 6.1.1 Tiles “A tile map (raster or vector) is a map displayed in a browser by seamlessly joining dozens of individually requested image files over the internet.” Let’s create a simple map: library(leaflet) # load the library mymap<-leaflet() %>% addTiles # images you are going to see mymap #check the map Now, it is time to explore different tiles: CartoDB: mymap<-leaflet() %>% addProviderTiles(provider ="CartoDB.Positron") mymap #check the map ESRI World Imagery: mymap<-leaflet() %>% addProviderTiles(provider ="Esri.WorldImagery") mymap #check the map Night lights: mymap<-leaflet() %>% addProviderTiles(provider ="NASAGIBS.ViirsEarthAtNight2012") mymap #check the map Now that we have the basic map, let’s populate it with some fun projects! 6.2 Project 1: Load data points Download the datasets available in canopy (*csv): data<-read.csv("MOCK_DATA.csv") mymap<-leaflet(data = data) %>% addTiles %>% # images you are going to see addMarkers(lng = ~long, lat = ~lat, popup = ~city) mymap #check the map Remember these dataset have no real data, it was created for learning purposes. 6.3 Project 2: Processing your data data<-read.csv("MOCK_DATA2.csv") mymap<-leaflet(data=data) %>% addTiles %>% # images you are going to see addMarkers(lng = ~long, lat = ~lat, popup = ~country) mymap #check the map # EX 3 Filter by US rm(list = ls()) data<-read.csv("MOCK_DATA2.csv") onlyUS<-data[data$country=="US",] cleanUS<-na.omit(onlyUS) mymap<-leaflet(data = cleanUS) %>% addTiles %>% # images you are going to see addMarkers(lng = ~long, lat = ~lat, popup = ~income) mymap #check the map 6.4 Project 3: Adding a legend rm(list = ls()) data<-read.csv("MOCK_DATA2.csv") onlyUS<-data[data$country=="US",] cleanUS<-na.omit(onlyUS) pal = colorNumeric("RdYlBu", domain = cleanUS$income) mymap<-leaflet(data = cleanUS) %>% addTiles %>% # images you are going to see addCircles(lng = ~long, lat = ~lat, popup = ~city, radius = ~sqrt(income)*200, color = ~pal(income), fillOpacity = 1, opacity = 1) %>% addLegend(title = "Income",pal = pal, values = ~income,position = "bottomright") mymap #Generate your map 6.4.1 Homework Using the fake data depicts North America cities (Mexico, Canada, United States).
